extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 10.3: What were the arguments for and against the Bank of the United States?,

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Understand 10 05

config.question: For opponents and supporters alike, the Bank of the United States represented __________.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Jackson’s opposition to the bank was largely motivated by personal animosity. Jackson had strong reservations about banking and paper money in general—in part because of his own brushes with bankruptcy after accepting promissory notes that depreciated in value. He also harbored suspicions that branches of the Bank of the United States had illicitly supported Adams in 1828. See L.O. 10.3 What were the arguments for and against the Bank of the United States?
